title: THIS IS THE MOST EXPENSIVE TRACTOR REPAIR I'VE EVER HEARD OF

tasks.task: Responding to an equipment failure and offering advice to a fellow farmer.
subtasks: Rolling out a tractor for leaf blowing.
Backing up misaligned to the roll of leaves.
Applying forward pedal, resulting in axle breakage.
Tractor rolling down a hill.
Rear axles breaking upon impact with a tree.
Discussing the accelerated wear of drive shaft U-joints in older tractors.
Ingesting large sums for rear axle replacements.
Scouring for replacement parts or selling the scrap.

tasks.task: Sharing farming equipment knowledge and experiences.
subtasks: Describing past experiences with equipment failures, including a John Deere 2320 with a U-joint failure.
Discussing the financial implications of repairs versus part replacement.
Recommending DIY repairs and part scavenging for economic efficiency.
Addressing the importance of regular maintenance and safety measures.
Promoting safety solutions like RimGuard for tractor stability.
Advocating the use of video subscriptions and website resources for equipment information.
Encouraging community support and market information sharing.

tasks.task: Responding to an equipment failure and offering advice to a fellow farmer. Under that, there are the subtasks related to the incident: rolling the tractor (first subtask), backing up misaligned (second), applying the forward pedal (third), which leads to the axle breakage (fourth). Then the tractor rolling down the hill and hitting a tree (fifth), causing more damage.

there's a bit about past experiences with tractors and the advice given. So another major task would be MAINTASK: Sharing farming equipment knowledge and experiences. Under this, the subtasks include discussing their own past equipment failures (like the John Deere 2320)(subtask), explaining the financial aspects of repairs versus part replacement (subtask), giving DIY advice on part scavenging versus selling the whole thing (subtask). They also mention safety (RimGuard) and resources (GoodWorktractors.com), which are their promotions, so perhaps that's another subtask in sharing info.
Responding to an equipment failure and offering advice to a fellow farmer.
Sharing farming equipment knowledge and experiences.
MAINTASK: Discussing safety in farming operations.
subtasks: Promoting RimGuard for safety.
